page.title: 01Landscape-Vale of Glamorgan
page.content: Our area is part of the Vale of Glamorgan.The underlying rock is of blue lias limestone,and the land is a fairly flat plain,very close to the sea,with an average height of 70m.above sea level.The area is predominantly agricultural.There are 20 farms spread throughout the area,and farmland covers over 90% of it.It's mainly covered in grass;for pasture,hay and sileage,and non-grass crops such as barley and potatoes. Animals are chiefly cattle,both dairy and beef,and also sheep. Atlantic College is situated in the area.It is a unique type of sixth form college where students from many countries attend. Apart from this there is very little or no other industry.The area includes the tiny villages of St.Donats and Marcross.
